ranges.notes: Major holiday - most attractions closed, cold weather (2-6°C), post-celebration cleanup, limited transport
considerations: Excellent for photography with fewer crowds

ranges.notes: Coldest period (0-4°C), possible snow, ideal for indoor activities, very low tourism

cherryBlossomLocations.parcDeSceaux: First to bloom, 25 min from center

ranges.notes: Fun cultural atmosphere, cherry blossoms peak, perfect spring weather
ranges.culturalTradition: Paper fish pranks, playful atmosphere throughout the city

ranges.notes: Cherry blossoms in full spectacular bloom, ideal weather (10-17°C), photography paradise

ranges.notes: Perfect spring conditions (12-18°C), comfortable temperatures, ideal sightseeing, one of the best periods to visit

specialConsiderations.weather: Most stable spring weather but sudden showers possible

ranges.notes: National holiday - many closures, lily of the valley sales, quiet streets

considerations: Ceremony at Tomb of Unknown Soldier

ranges.notes: Perfect conditions (12-20°C), pre-peak tourism, ideal weather, locals enjoy café terraces

Long warm evenings perfect for dining

ranges.notes: Excellent weather (14-23°C), long daylight hours, pre-peak season, ideal conditions

rolandGarros.tip: Finals weekend very busy in western Paris

considerations: One of the best times to visit

ranges.notes: Pre-summer solstice, warming up (16-24°C), tourism increasing but manageable
Free live music everywhere, summer solstice celebration, magical evening, longest day of the year
Early summer (16-25°C), tourism increasing, long warm evenings

considerations: One of the best Paris experiences

Hot weather (17-27°C), urban beaches continue, many Parisians on vacation, some closures

closureWarnings.tip: Check if favorite spots are open before going

ranges.notes: Public holiday, religious celebrations, many closures
Crowds decreasing, weather still warm (16-25°C), city slowly returning to normal

considerations: School supply shopping fun to observe

ranges.notes: Arguably the best time to visit (13-21°C), perfect weather, locals back, cultural season starts
Historic buildings open free, normally closed sites accessible, fantastic cultural weekend

considerations: Book hotels early if during Fashion Week

ranges.notes: Beautiful autumn weather (10-17°C), fall foliage beginning, comfortable temperatures

ranges.price: Some events free, wine tasting varies

Major holiday, most closures, family day, quiet streets

Major celebration, fireworks expectations, champagne celebrations, festive finale

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds, best value
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds, good value
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism, fair value
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very high crowds, limited value
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or limited activities, poor value

challenges.summer: Very crowded, expensive, hot for kids
challenges.winter: Cold weather, shorter days, indoor focus

markets.flea: Year-round weekends at Saint-Ouen, Vanves, Montreuil

seasonal.autumn: Mushrooms, game, wine harvest, oysters begin
seasonal.winter: Oysters, comfort food, holiday specialties, truffles

reservations.recommended: Always for dinner at popular spots

daylight.tip: Adjust schedule to daylight - Paris is magical at golden hour

metro.airConditioning: Some lines, not all - challenging in summer
metro.strikes: Possible any time, more common autumn/winter
metro.allNight: Fête de la Musique, New Year's Eve

cycling.winter: Possible but cold and potentially slippery

valuePricing.strategy: Book 2-3 months ahead for best rates

accommodation.airConditioning: Essential July-August, many boutique hotels lack AC

reservations.timeline: 1-4 weeks ahead for popular restaurants, months for Michelin

closures.holidays: Christmas Day, New Year's Day, May 1st limited
closures.sunday: Many traditional bistros closed Sunday evening, some all day

monthlyHighlights.january: Winter sales, cozy museums, authentic local experience, galette des rois
monthlyHighlights.february: Valentine's romance, fewer crowds, winter sales end, cultural immersion
monthlyHighlights.march: Spring awakening, cherry blossoms begin, perfect walking temperatures
monthlyHighlights.april: Cherry blossom peak, ideal weather, Paris Marathon, Easter festivities
monthlyHighlights.may: Perfect conditions, Nuit des Musées, Roland Garros, outdoor dining
monthlyHighlights.june: Longest days, Fête de la Musique, pre-peak crowds, magical evenings
monthlyHighlights.july: Bastille Day, Paris Plages, peak summer, vibrant energy
monthlyHighlights.august: Urban beaches, locals away, late-month renaissance (rentrée)
monthlyHighlights.september: Post-peak perfection, Fashion Week, Heritage Days, ideal conditions
monthlyHighlights.october: Autumn beauty, Nuit Blanche, Montmartre harvest, comfortable temperatures
monthlyHighlights.november: Cozy atmosphere, Beaujolais Nouveau, Christmas markets begin
monthlyHighlights.december: Christmas magic, holiday markets, spectacular illuminations, festive atmosphere

overall.why: Perfect weather, moderate crowds, cultural events, outdoor dining

budget.why: Lowest prices, fewest crowds, great for museums

romance.why: Beautiful weather, long evenings, outdoor dining

families.why: Good weather, manageable crowds, school-break alignment
